etymology.description: 寒 (cold; chill) + 秋 (autumn) = the cold phase of autumn (late autumn).
etymology.interpretation: Literary compound referring to the chilly part of autumn, often late autumn when temperatures drop. Evokes a crisp, somber seasonal atmosphere.

parts.english: cold; chill; poor (literary); to feel cold

examples.chinese: 寒秋将至(寒秋將至)，夜里渐凉(夜裡漸涼)。
examples.pinyin: Hánqiū jiāng zhì, yèlǐ jiàn liáng.
examples.english: Late autumn approaches, and the nights grow cooler.

examples.chinese: 在寒秋时节(在寒秋時節)，枫叶尽染(楓葉盡染)。
examples.pinyin: Zài hánqiū shíjié, fēngyè jìn rǎn.
examples.english: In the chill of late autumn, the maple leaves are fully tinged with color.

examples.chinese: 诗人于寒秋独坐江畔(詩人於寒秋獨坐江畔)，感怀万千(感懷萬千)。
examples.pinyin: Shīrén yú hánqiū dú zuò jiāngpàn, gǎn huái wàn qiān.
examples.english: A poet sits alone by the river in late autumn, filled with many emotions.
